Functions for evaluating the performance of the models and plotting the results.

classmethod kfold_comparison_plot(comparing_models_metrics)[source]ïƒ

Plotting function for comparing models on kfold metrics. Produces a violin plot.

Parameters:

Returns:

fig â€“ Figure containing the violin plots.

Return type:

classmethod get_new_kfold_data(model_list, params, data_file_suffix, checkpoint_file_suffix=None)[source]ïƒ

Putting new data into each k-fold trained model: we donâ€™t need to split the new data into folds. We just need to get the predictions for each fold and plot them.

classmethod get_new_tt_data(model, params, data_file_suffix, checkpoint_file_suffix=None)[source]ïƒ

Get new data by running through trained model for a train/test model.

Parameters:

  • model (nn.Module) â€“ The trained model.

  • sources (list) â€“ List of sources to get data from. [tabular1source csv, tabular2source csv, image csv]

  • params (dict) â€“ Additional parameters.

  • data_file_suffix (str) â€“ Suffix that is on the new data csv and pt files. e.g. â€œ_new_dataâ€ or â€œ_testâ€

  • checkpoint_file_suffix (str, optional) â€“ Suffix that is on the trained model checkpoint files. e.g. â€œ_firsttryâ€. Added by the user. Default is None.

Return type:

return train_reals, train_preds, val_reals, val_preds, metric_values

classmethod get_tt_data_from_model(model)[source]ïƒ

Get the data from a train/test model.

Parameters:

model (nn.Module) â€“ The trained model.

Returns:

  • train_reals (torch.Tensor) â€“ The real values for the training set.

  • train_preds (torch.Tensor) â€“ The predicted values for the training set.

  • val_reals (torch.Tensor) â€“ The real values for the validation set.

  • val_preds (torch.Tensor) â€“ The predicted values for the validation set.

  • metric_values (dict) â€“ The values of the metrics for the model.

class RealsVsPreds[source]ïƒ

Bases: ParentPlotter

Plots the real values vs the predicted values for a model. Pink dots are the training data, green dots are the validation data. The validation data is either new data if using from_new_data or the original validation data if using from_final_val_data.

Parameters:

  • which_data (str) â€“ Either â€œfrom_new_dataâ€ or â€œfrom_final_val_dataâ€.

  • model (nn.Module) â€“ The trained model.

  • X (torch.Tensor) â€“ The data to plot.

  • y (torch.Tensor) â€“ The labels for the data.
